meanings.definition: Formed in the mind before full consideration or knowledge.
meanings.sent1: She had a preconceived notion that all cats were mean.
meanings.sent2: His preconceived beliefs about the topic influenced his judgment.
meanings.sent3: It was funny how his preconceived ideas about the movie were completely wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her preconceived fears about public speaking held her back.
meanings.sent5: The preconceived image of the haunted house made her hesitant to enter.

meanings.definition: To form an opinion or idea before having full knowledge or experience.
meanings.sent1: Try not to preconceive the outcome before giving it a chance.
meanings.sent2: She preconceived the situation based on rumors rather than facts.
meanings.sent3: He always preconceived how the party would turn out, but it never happened that way.
meanings.sent4: Don't preconceive the taste of the dish before trying it.
meanings.sent5: Preconceiving the difficulty of the task made it seem impossible to accomplish.
